titles.title: Relating to the extradition of Martin Pang from Brazil to the United States.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on International Relations.
Referred to the Subcommittee on the Western Hemisphere.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Committee Agreed to Seek Consideration Under Suspension of the Rules, (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Mr. Gilman moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: Received in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 9/24/1996--Passed House amended. Calls for the Government of Brazil to grant its consent to prosecution of Martin Pang for arson and felony murder.
